snippet: As the Senate prepares to take up a proposal to expand background checks on all gun purchases, problems have let thousands of people who should have been barred buy firearms.
abstract: Senate is preparing to take up proposal to expand background checks on all gun purchases, as current loopholes allow buyers to skirt checks; gaps in Federal Bureau of Investigation's database of criminal and mental health records, which are consulted during checks, have allowed thousands to buy firearms who should have been barred.

byline.original: By MICHAEL COOPER, MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and MICHAEL LUO

lead_paragraph: As the Senate prepares to take up a proposal to expand background checks on all gun purchases, problems have let thousands of people who should have been barred buy firearms.

headline.seo: Gun Law Loopholes Let Buyers Skirt Background Checks
headline.main: Loopholes in Gun Laws Allow Buyers to Skirt Checks
headline.print_headline: Loopholes in Gun Regulations Allow Buyers to Skirt Background Checks
